name: Kalam Polo (Persian Cabbage and Rice)
author: Soheila
summary: It is a traditional Persian cuisine with an aromatic flavor. You can omit the ground beef if you want it vegetarian. Serve it with shirazi salad it will taste wonderful.
directions: Pour boiling water over ground saffron; let sit for 30 minutes
Reserve 1/4 cup for rice; save remaining brewed saffron for another use
Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat
Saute onion until light brown, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir in ground beef, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and turmeric
Cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Cover the pan and cook over low heat for 15 minutes
Heat remaining oil in another pan over medium heat
Saute cabbage until tender, about 5 minutes
Stir mixture into ground beef mixture and continue to cook over low heat, covered, for 5 minutes, adding 1 tablespoon of water if mixture is dry
Rinse and drain rice; transfer to a pot
Add cold water, butter, and remaining salt
Bring mixture to a boil, uncovered
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until rice is half-cooked and water has evaporated, 10 to 15 minutes
Add beef mixture to the rice and slowly mix to incorporate
Add hot water and reserved 1/4 cup brewed saffron to the rice, cover the pot, and let cook until rice is tender, about 20 minutes
